title: Some problems with Chinese editing and use of the software
content:
Expect Thunderbird to become an international software, currently Thunderbird computer side in the use of Chinese face the following problems: 1, the software interface is not fully Chinese 2, the mail editor does not support the first line of paragraph indentation support for Chinese, manual blank line two cells, but the other party received the e-mail display is not to achieve the effect of the first line of the indentation of two spaces. 3, now the mail editor is too old, there is no plan to upgrade the more modern and intuitive, the form of support is also quite weak and clumsy. Overall, I hope to improve the overall support for Chinese usage, thanks to the development team for their excellent work.

　　期待Thunderbird成为国际性的软件，目前Thunderbird电脑端在中文使用上面临以下问题： 　　1、软件界面未完全汉化 　　2、邮件编辑器对中文支持没有段落首行缩进支持，手工空行两格但对方收到的邮件显示并不是想达到的首行缩进两空格的效果。 　　3、现在的邮件编辑器太古老，有无计划升级的更现代化和直观化，对表格的支持也相当弱和笨拙。 　　总体来说希望提升对中文使用的整体性支持，感谢开发团队的优秀作品。
creator: gc35766

title: Outgoing server (SMTP) timed out, unable to send email
content:
Hello!

I'm an intern and my company recently made an email for me to ease communication. I open the account on my Thunderbird and I am able to receive the emails in inbox well but I could not send my email due to Outgoing server (SMTP) timed out. I already tried the steps I found on the internet such as ensuring the port is correct, excluding the app from the firewall, increasing the timed out from 100 to 300 and restarting the app and my laptop. I still received error in sending out messages. Please help. Below is my Outgoing server information. Do let me know if i need to provide extra information to assist in aid. Thank you in advance.

Description: <not specified> Server Name: *******.securev.net Port: 587 User Name: *****@***.org.my Authentication method: Normal password Connection Security: STARTTLS

title: Send Mail Fails
content:
I've tried the troubleshooting steps outlined in the FAQ but have not been able to send any email messages. This just started a few days ago and I've tried these things with no luck:

  • Disable firewall
  • Disable anti-virus
  • Change SMTP settings
  • Change email account PW

Windows 11 Norton 360 NordVPN

I don't know if this has any bearing on the issue, but at the same time as I began having trouble sending email, I attempted to install the UPS label printer software. It also looks like there was an update to my AV/Firewall software, but since I have disabled both, as well as disabling the VPN, and there's still no success, I'm ruling those out for now.

NOTE: I have no trouble sending or receiving email with my phone, so I tend to thinnk it's not the account settings. I've tried using the phone as a hotspot to send from my PC but that also was not successful.

Thanks in advance for any assistance!

title: Thunderbird cannot connect to any server on a new PC
content: I have a correctly working Thunderbird, with around 15 email accounts connecting to different servers, on 1 Windows PC. I moved the setup to a new Windows PC as described here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer ("alternative method"). Thunderbird version is 128.8.1esr on both PCs. On the new PC, Thunderbird gives a timeout connecting to any of the IMAP or POP3 servers. I have disabled the Windows firewall and uninstalled a McAfee virus scanner. When I restart Thunderbird in troubleshoot mode, everything works correctly (!). However, when I select "disable all add-ons" and "Reset toolbars and controls" + "Make changes and restart", the connection timeouts again occur. What can I do to make Thunderbird behave correctly as in troubleshoot mode?

creator: hollinsrob

title: Can Thunderbird replace my Outlook scenario?
content:
I'm looking for an email solution for my husband and Thunderbird looks promising. However I'd really appreciate input from this community regarding our specific scenario before I make a move. I have a programming background but I fumble blindly trying to be his email admin.

The problem we are trying to solve is his current email setup chokes on send/receive almost daily, after which he has to use Task Manager to kill a hanging Outlook.exe process. After years of tinkering I'm about to give up on Outlook completely. I think the main issue is how Outlook interacts with his Archive. His Archive.pst file is 4GB and Outlook saves it as one big file even though it has many subfolders which are essentially his filing system. Outlook is configured to save everything directly to a local laptop which is backed up regularly and we want to retain this local feature. Thunderbird is attractive because: 1. it supports the local drive storage 2. it appears to have options for transferring his Outlook archive and other folders over in such a way that he can continue to search and access them as needed. He would also like to be able to: 1. move new emails received in Thunderbird into the same (transferred) archive subfolders he has now 2. send and receive new emails without the program choking 3. view and send new emails from his Android phone (without accessing the archive) 4. transfer his email contacts from Outlook and manage them in Thunderbird Can anyone see red flags with this in Thunderbird? He does NOT use: 

- Outlook Calendar (we synch our phone calendars to Google calendar online) - Outlook Tasks

Technical Details (in case it matters): 

- HP Pavilion 2021 laptop running Windows 10 with 1TB storage (200+ GB free) and 16GB RAM - Likely to upgrade to a newer bigger laptop with Windows 11 this year - Outlook is running from a Microsoft 365 subscription - His actual email account is from gmail but is named per a domain name I purchased - His Outlook account is setup using IMAP - We use ESET for virus protection and NordVPN for WIFI security

Any comments or advice are greatly appreciated!
creator: BoulderRidge
